Award.AwardTitle: Conference on Advances in Geographic Information Systems 2019: Student Activities and U.S.-Based Students Support

Directorate.LongName: Direct For Computer & Info Scie & Enginr

Award.AbstractNarration:
This award provides support for U.S.-based students to attend the 27th Association for Computing Machinery Special Interest Group on Spatial Information (ACM SIGSPATIAL) International Conference on Advances in Geographic Information Systems, November 5-8, 2019 in Chicago, IL. The ACM SIGSPATIAL conference is the world's premier research conference in Spatial Information and Geographic Information Systems. The conference brings together researchers, developers, users, and practitioners carrying out research and development in novel systems based on geospatial data and knowledge, and fostering interdisciplinary discussions and research in a wide set of disciplines and applications, including computer science, geography, urban planning, land-use, and defense. The ACM SIGSPATIAL conference seeks to foster development of a new generation of researchers and practitioners in the important area of Spatial Information and Geographic Information Systems.

The ACM SIGSPATIAL International Conference on Advances in Geographic Information Systems 2019 is the 27th event in a series of symposia and workshops that began in 1993 with the aim of bringing together researchers, developers, users, and practitioners in relation to novel systems based on geo-spatial data and knowledge, and fostering interdisciplinary discussions and research in all aspects of geographic information systems. The conference provides a forum for original research contributions covering all conceptual, design, and implementation aspects of geospatial data ranging from applications, user interfaces, and visualization to data storage and query processing and indexing. The ACM SIGSPATIAL conference will feature research presentations, workshops, demonstrations, poster sessions, and student-focused activities, including a student research competition, a spatial computing competition, and mentoring by senior researchers. Proceedings of the 27th ACM SIGSPATIAL International Conference on Advances in Geographic Information Systems will be available in the ACM Digital Library.

This award reflects NSF's statutory mission and has been deemed worthy of support through evaluation using the Foundation's intellectual merit and broader impacts review criteria.

POR.DRECONTENT:
The ACM SIGSPATIAL conference started in 1993 as a workshop and expanding in a symposium, co-located with ACM CIKM. It established itself as the ACM GIS conference in 2007; and, finally, after obtaining its SIG with the ACM, in 2013 it started being held in its present form: ACM SIGSPATIAL. It has established itself as a leading forum for researchers and practitioners to publish their work and present the results in the areas of spatial and spatio-temporal data analysis, algorithms and, more broadly, geographic information systems (GIS).

One of the main enabling factors to maintain US competitive status in this active and vibrant field is to ensure a participation of US-based students at ACM SIGSPATIAL. The topics addressed by the research, industry, vision and demo papers in this conference are impacting many applications of extreme societal relevance, spanning through efficient transportation, geospatial intelligence, effective environmental data management and analytics, and infectious diseases tracking - to name but a few. 

In addition to participating in the research results presented in the main track, along with the record number of 15 co-located workshops, there were two additional student-centered activities at SIGSPATIAL 2018: (1) The 8th SIGSPATIAL Cup, a GIS-focused algorithm competition; and (2) The 4th Student Research Competition (SRC)  where submission were describing recent research conducted primarily by students or a recent development that involves a substantial amount of work achieved primarily by students, both graduate and undergraduate.

Thanks to the $25K support by the NSF with this grant, financial assistance was provided for a record number of 60 students-participants for ACM SIGSPATIAL 2019.
